# Piper's Hill (Kettering BC Ward)

{| border=1 cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" align="right" width=300
|-
!colspan=2 align=center bgcolor="#ff9999"|'''Piper's Hill' Ward (Kettering Borough Council)

!colspan=2 align=center|Piper's Hill within Kettering Borough

|align=center|Kettering Borough within Northamptonshire
|align=right|Northamptonshire within England
|}
'Piper's Hill Ward is a two-member ward within Kettering Borough Council which is statistically regarded as a marginal ward between Liberal Democrats and the Conservatives. The ward was last fought at borough council level in the 2015 local council elections, in which one seat was won by the Conservatives and one seat was won by Labour.
The current councillors are Cllr. Duncan Bain and Cllr. Anne Lee.

*John Coleman (Liberal Democrat) – served as mayor from 2000 to 2001.
*Fred Brown (Conservative)
Current ward boundaries (2007–)
Kettering Borough Council elections 2007
*At the 2007 elections, Piper's Hill ward was enlarged with part of the former Warkton ward, a Labour-held ward.
